title: Fix Saline Soils: Regenerative Farmers/Ranchers Share Proven Tips for Restoring Soil Health & Yields

tasks.task: Farms affected by saline patches face challenges and must adapt.
subtasks: Farmers in James River Valley deal with rising salinity in fields.
The Hamilton brothers in South Dakota changed their farming methods.
Broilers discuss adapting to changing weather patterns and water levels.
They shifted from annual crops to overseeding with salt-tolerant blends.
The brothers use a mix of grasses, foxtail, fescue, and saline alfalfa.
They vary the seed blend based on soil type and local conditions.
No-tilling and applying herbicides prepare the ground for the seed mix.
Grazing and hay production improve soil health and manage weed growth.
The salt-tolerant plants help in soil recovery, supporting wildlife and hunting.
The approach aims for long-term sustainability rather than short-term gains.
